definition: to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: His reputation was blemished by a newspaper article alleging he had taken bribes.
sentences.chinese: 报纸上一篇文章说他纳贿，他的光荣以是遭到玷污。

sentences.english: The agent accommodated afterwards accepting been begin accusable of bribery.
sentences.chinese: 这位议员被证明犯有行贿纳贿罪后辞职了。

sentences.english: He continues to take bribes until the end of the novel, when Obi decides he cannot stand it anymore.
sentences.chinese: 他继续纳贿直至小说，当欧比决定，他不能忍受它了。

sentences.english: The briber described the tribe head's bribery.
sentences.chinese: 贿赂者描写了部降首级的纳贿行动。

definition: to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to accuse/to impeach/(in imperial China) to level charges against an official
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
to exact bribes/to solicit bribes/to demand bribes/to extort
to curry favor/to advance one's career by toadying
to buy a title/to use wealth to acquire office
